I paid like four-fiddy for a pint, reasonable, I guess.  The location's cool, too and Red Jack has a real cozy, kind of down-home vibe to it that makes time really fly when you're there.

iXk4m8yIepm0zJldsahxww.review_text: Small bar but relaxed atmosphere. I saw woman with her retriever in the bar. It was freaking awesome. The dog was well behaved and super friendly. I guess that is how they roll in San Francisco.

TMt47-ghHgy7hVSgvGXhQA.review_text: Been going here once a week since I moved into the near neighborhood 4 years ago. Still have not received friendly service, with the exception of the curly haired lady ;). Crazy I would rather spend money at Hillstone where they all know my name and know where I'm from.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: 102 - 89  No big thing, that's just the final score in game 1 of the NBA Finals featuring the Lakers and those crummy Celtics that I just had the pleasure of watching at Red Jack Saloon.  Sooooo, when some co-workers of mine broached the subject of watching Kobe Bryant whoop dat ass in North Beach this evening, the idea of checking out the action at Red Jack was born. Little did I know, though, that this spot was a well-known Boston bar! Arrrrrrgh! Had I known that, I'd have opted to listen to the game with a strung out trucker named Gil over a CB Radio along the dusty roads of Barstow. But hey... I was already there with some good company (meaning the people I came with), so I really had no other option but to stick it out.  The bar itself wasn't all that bad, but if you're not a fan of Boston sports, you might be pretty annoyed. I guess you have to give credit to those jerks for having relatively good sports teams and being passionate about their city... so I can't knock 'em too hard... but seriously, do you have to be sooooo obnoxious? I mean, they were cursing at The Joker fer Christ sake! There's no reason to bad mouth Jack Nickelson just because he's sitting court side at the Staples Center, right? What about Chris Rock and David Spade?!?! Anyhoo, I digress....  The bar has some pretty decent drink specials, which made up for the rowdy, potty mouthed fans. Though not reinventing the wheel by any means, tonight was "Thirsty Thursday," which meant we were privy to $3.50 well cocktails for the entire evening. They have a chalk board with the rest of the week's bargains, but I was too busy being sprayed with saliva by a rotund gentleman with a thick accent and a faux-vintage green Celtics shirt from Urban Outfitters to soak it all in. But even though I wasn't able to take notes, I'm willing to bet the incentives would leave me with no option but to return at a later date.   They threw in some free hot dogs for the entire bar, so that was a pretty nice treat (if you like manufactured meat byproducts, that is) so even if you're a sports fan in the minority, you have to respect the generosity. If you despise Boston sports, however, you may want to wait until all of their teams have the day off. Just sayin'.

XG-JynrbKiiNaqT4ffdI_w.review_text: A good laid back bar in north beach. Doesn't get crowded and it has darts and a bunch of other games floating around (like trivial pursuit and connect 4)

dP2vQRFB0xK5bD-aCGZM1w.review_text: stop number 2 on a random sunday bar crawl. nice bar, lots of seating, lots of tvs to watch whatever games are on, bartenders were nice. they had an "all you can eat" bbq going if you donated $5. it looked like they had an outdoor patio seating area in the back but i didn't venture out there because i didn't want to get sucked in to getting some food. it smelled great though. i would come back if i was in the area.

77v-IIrCEjwWYXYq9pI20Q.review_text: Tourists need not bother. No service with foreign I.D.

kyG14FyCWmVW3Uefs_GE_Q.review_text: Great bar.  The drinks are stiff and the patrons and bar tenders are nice.  There is a dart board, and a pretty good juke box.   Bonus star for being a half block from my apartment. :)

II3SZQD1NE0zcN4fQqohug.review_text: My watering whole in North Beach!  I loved just kicking back and enjoying my Jamesons and playing darts with my bro's.   Truth S. says it right, for a bunch of Chowder Heads, Mark and co make us Yankee fans feel welcome. When I lived there, Mark and his wife were the best and really made you feel at home. I still have my Red Hook Stein!

cwnT8BJHEo1_0mh-t8h1MA.review_text: I am a recent addition to SF. My first week at my new job a few people from work invited me to this quaint dive bar.  It  was on that first night that it immediately reminded me of that kind of home-y, "Cheers-esque" pub where the bartender always remembers your name and your drink and serves it with the same warmth and welcoming smile as they did on the very first visit.  While Nicole is usually the one that keeps the Stellas coming, Nick and Mike are equally as friendly with all the patrons, whether they're working or just enjoying a brew like the rest of us.  These people, their friendliness and off-the-cuff humor made my boyfriend and I instantly fall in love with this place.  My only qualm would be that this is a Red Sox bar, being a native New Yorker...well you can understand. : ) However...These are West Coast Sox fans, no offense Red Jacks, that just means we can forgive each other for our baseball teams and drink together in harmony.    This is so far the best place for an uncomplicated after work adult beverage where you can relax play Jenga, sing along to Journey on the Juke Box and meet the kind of down to earth people you feel like you've known your whole life.  Thanks Nicole, Mike and Nick for helping us strangers find our own little nook of SF to call our own.

NvOjbDnMX12YIY8zSPOxsg.review_text: Best pats bar in the city!!!!  Cheap beer, great TVs, great beer on tap, awesome drink specials.  They even have free food when the pats play.  My boyfriend and I love coming here and don't see ourselves watching the game anywhere else anytime soon.

_I-jEFK9dWfE3u_gZz_BfQ.review_text: best place to drink by the pier, because f the hard rock and their $12 vodkas  Not many tourists, although i like seeing tourists. Some come in at times,... leaving them very open to be hit on! HEY NOW!!  Good stiff drinks, for a very reasonable (Cheap for SF) price.   Last weekend they had The Oscars on one TV, and NBA Basketball on the other... all good!  try it!

jEyb7v42sgIZZhwxnynFfg.review_text: BEST dive bar nearest to the Wharf BY far. Once I met some drunken crazy Irish guy here who's accent was so thick I thought he was speaking Celtic at times (maybe he was?). He was going on & on in a stupor it was hysterical.  Drunken tourist watching is great here! In & Out Burger is close by which give the extra star.

TLJZzsqtDW-loSGsuvTcwg.review_text: Amazing $6 Bloody Mary on Sunday! Variety of games, small outdoor patio. They had a "skinny colada" which was great. Piña colada vodka, soda water and a splash of pineapple juice.   The bartender Shauna was super nice.

YT__5KZS30Wn0kR6MEdM5A.review_text: I spent a couple weeks in town for work, and they put me up in a Fisherman's Wharf hotel.  I spent the two weeks cursing tourists and trying to find a bar they hadn't taken over.  A few days before I left, I found this place, and I'm tempted to move out there just for this bar.  As every other reviewer has said, this place is incredibly laid-back and unpretentious.  I spent a few nights hanging out with the regulars and had a blast.  Everyone there was really friendly, the drinks were cheap, and OAR's live version of Crazy Game of Poker came on the jukebox every hour or two (it's like 11 minutes long - best value for your jukebox dollar, according the the guy that kept playing it).  They don't do food there, but they have a bunch of delivery menus at the bar so you can have food delivered there.  I even got to meet Darwin Coon, one of the last guys off Alcatraz when it closed, and bought a signed copy of his book right there.  Honestly, I feel a little guilty giving this place a good rating, because I don't want tourists to find out about it - I'll be back in SF again sooner or later, and I'll damn sure be going back to Red Jack.

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: Well I checked in too early we got rejected for a just expired CDL. Oh well they don't have food anyway...

h--UcE1zaeZwmqQ3M0HMiQ.review_text: This bar seemed sad inside on a Saturday night and the drinks were dismal. They had outdoor seating and smoking listed on their yelp info and the party I was with was told they couldn't smoke, because it was a residential area where other apartments were near?! My friend found it annoying that they listed Themselves as smoking allowed but didn't have it.

KbJp5kb-AMB7ixBPref8WA.review_text: As far as dive bars go, this is a pretty good place. I think they have three (?) plasmas in the place and it makes for easy viewing, esp on Saturdays when I'm in the mood to watch UCLA football. :) The crowds get pretty loud at night though, which is a pain for me cause I live in the next building over... Meh, but it's a bar, I'd expect there to be noise.

4UwdzGAN7CnYha1olmKbrA.review_text: It's a wicked pissah of a bar

re6fN6eb3NTL7hKK-5CYUQ.review_text: Nicole is the friendliest bartender we know. She welcomed us to the neighborhood and made my drinks just the way I liked it. The drink prices can't be beat and the whole bar is clean. I like the fact that there's a dart board in the back and you can watch sports while hanging at the bar. This is my new favorite bar in North Beach.

TFI8STov0eFGe9fWVFBb2w.review_text: This place is a great little bar.  The drinks are cheap, the people are great, and best of all:  its the only Redskins bar in SF!  Hail!

KDewJBJknfWvQyHHFNbfdg.review_text: Neighborhood bar? Tourist bar? Boston bar? No one is quite sure, even when we could stand there during the 7 minute wait for three High Lifes the answer just wasn't there. These days being a "Boston bar" is nearly as common as being a SF bar. I'd likely love this bar if I lived within two blocks of it, but beyond that I wouldn't seek it out. Harsh tones, yes. However, they do complete the age old trinity of being a bar: 1. There's a bar. 2. There's a guy with booze that stands behind it. 3. There's space where you can stand in front of it with the booze you obtain from said guy. Ta da! After that, nothing else really matters. When you're wandering around after realizing that Beer 39 is a souvenir store and not the dingy dive hidden gem amidst Pier 39 that you wished, drink the memories of that albatross away at The Red Jack Saloon.

odq8SUSIT8narMOKlZrg6Q.review_text: I stopped in here with a friend who used to work nearby.  It's one of those "where everybody knows you name" kind of bars and my friend had memories of fun times insider.  I can see an afterwork crown gathering here but we arrived a bit earlier and there were some locals that seemed very much at home.  No one knew who we were and it took a while to get anyone's attention, but the beer was cold and that's all I needed.  We hung out for a while and then left because we had dinner reservations down the street.  I doubt if I'll ever set foot inside the place again.  There was nothing wrong with it, but I'm a tourist when I'm in SF and I like to explore new places.

EmPr6_Ln9ciSAX2NM6Murg.review_text: If you ever find yourself down at the Wharf--against your will or otherwise--you owe it to yourself to drop into this little gem, a quintessential neighborhood bar under the red awning on Bay Street just east of Stockton.  The bartenders are friendly, real people, as are the rest of the people you'll run into in the joint.  Daily drink specials--including Bloody Mary's on the weekends, when you need them most--are a highlight, as is the stellar jukebox and the open-air space out back.  Tell Mark and Laurie that Drew sent you --and that I said "hey"--and I bet they may even hook you up with a free drink.

lky6Ccb8Z1VIb3ii5Cm3oQ.review_text: Before traveling out to my first trip to CA, I browsed the internet for any bars that may cater to Redskin fans.  Low and behold, The Red Jack Saloon appears.  After a few days in SF, I ventured out and finally found The Red Jack and loved the place.  Loved Nicole, the bartender that night.  Other patrons I met that night were very friendly...we talked sports, music, etc...I felt like I was a regular there....I've never felt like that here in the Northern Virginia area....would love to go back and stay longer.  Lastly, their jukebox contained some great rock music, Alice In Chains in particular!

2cZxkCOtl4CcuTqPRBzc7Q.review_text: Redskins bar that opens early for Sunday 10am games. Doesn't serve food but you can get food from other locations and bring in to eat and watch the game.

RyWKKwLzLSWi_8bZd1QWYQ.review_text: So after my horrible experience at Butterfly, we decided to trek towards N.beach for some hopefully better bloody mary experiences.  On our way down Bay, we noticed this bar in a unusual area of town - not much else around at all. We were there pretty early and there was only a couple older locals in the place.  Seemed like a nice local/sports bar.  I noticed ingredients to make a bloody mary on the bar, so I 'thought' I was in luck ******Bloody Mary Review***** After I order a BM, the bartender grabs a quick pour filled with pre-mixed BM.  First sign things were not going well, since I knew he could have obviously made me one fresh.  He  sipped a small amount himself to make sure it tasted good.  Well I realized that after tasting mine, this guy didn't know what  a good bloody mary tasted like at all, since what I got was HORRIBLE!!!!  It not only didn't taste good, it actually tasted bad.   So I will likely not go back. Any bartender should at least know what tastes awful and refuse to serve me something that tasted that horrible.   It might be a good bar at night, it did seem like it had potential, but I most likely wouldn't recommend the need to travel to this area of town just to go. Read some of my other Bloody Mary reviews at: yelp.com/list_details?li…

Qrj3h5-x7h_oamVvfx8bwg.review_text: This place was for sure a local type bar! It was fun and everyone was so nice! We had a great time and plan on visiting every time we are in town! Great drinks!!

m8tIaIqVTVwZutcZRt5XRQ.review_text: The ladies who work here are awesome! Free Fenway franks during the World Series!  Good sox crowd all around! Thanks ladies!

b5xky1NsvoaUK4ScJT695g.review_text: Cool little neighborhood bar that has FROGGER!  Yes, FROGGER!  Usually an interesting mix of people in there, and the service is friendly.

BxxW0IAPxNL_dSAv2U9H5w.review_text: Best horrible(not) service ever! :) treats you like family; dances with you to random songs. Chad is an amazing bartender. Very friendly very nice and not Irish lol. Bring yourself here, and have an awesome time!

5517Yj-6hxE2IZl0xbRYYA.review_text: My friend and I were feeling spontaneous and left from out southern california town to san francisco and had no clue what we were getting ourselves into once we got to san francisco at 9pm we parked and walked to the closest bar here and this happend to be it the place is decked out in boston stuff I dont mind though the atmosphere in this place makes up for it the people seemed friendly and welcoming

r1AVLdGIUI4pMjnTZgi1aQ.review_text: This is a fun bar. We recently moved down the block from this place and we stumbled upon it on a walk from Safeway. We came in it was half way full and the Bartender welcomed us and we had a seat. We ordered some cocktails and we stated conversation with some of the locals that frequent the place.   Everyone is friendly, Northeast fun attitude. Mark the bartender has a funny remark every couple words that will cracked you up. Some of the patrons are young and talk alot of smack that makes you laugh. I swear I thought I was at a place like cheers. Everyone knows each other and if you are new everyone introduces themselves. We met the Laurie, Mark's better half. She was very nice and accommodating.   Thanks for the hospitality. One of our new places to hang out on a Fri after 5pm...   Keep serving great spirits...

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: not a red sox fan,not a bruins fan, still like this place. it's the consummate sports bar (boisterous patrons, fun bartenders, good quick drinks). they are cool with bringing in a pizza (ask first though) and the door guys are really awesome.

YlsRG3lhGpJFlQPa4bwB1A.review_text: I really don't want to tell people how great this bar is because then it won't be hidden gem anymore! When I say I love this bar, I mean I LOVE THIS F****** BAR! Awesome staff and clientele! Total local hang out! Love you girls!

EZlYr0ox8w8FbxyH5EhBEg.review_text: Passport required for non US ID holders. That's horse shit. We were promptly asked to leave because our friend didn't have a passport to show. I thought we were at a bar in SF, not a border crossing.   I wasn't going to write a negative review about it, I get it, your bartenders are too retarded to decipher someone's age. But, what really sealed the deal on what ASSHOLES these guys are is this:  We were standing outside Red Door trying to figure out our next move when a family riding bikes comes along. A boy about 6 years old is in DESPERATE need of the restroom. His father takes him inside Red Jack to see if he can escort is son to the bathroom (only sign of life on this block) as its an emergency and was told NO!   What kind of dirtbag bartender does that? Fuck these guys.

br6sFuJ5BOAP6NBh4g6HEw.review_text: Nice little local bar in what seems to be a quiet area, although the Embarcadero is just two streets down. The bartender was a lot of fun and the atmosphere over all was very relaxed.
